III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section Program statement
Description
1

(1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents' needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation There are concerns of conflicts of interest amongst leadership,
supervisors, and staff. It was reported that a supervisor has had a
sexual relationship with multiple staff and covers up for them. The
supervising staff provided youth with THC edibles, weed pens,
and energy drinks. When this was reported to leadership, the staff
reporting concerns was retaliated against.
Investigation These allegations were investigated under SI #2025SIC0000554.
There was no rule violations found.
Analysis These allegation were investigated under SI #2025SIC0000554.
There was no rule violations found.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section Intervention standards and prohibitions
Description (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A staff member witnessed a youth endure physical abuse by other
staff at the facility. The staff reported these concerns, but nothing
was done.
Investigation Interview:
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on 7/03/2025.
There was no additional information.
Youth A was interviewed face to face on 7/7/2025 at
Wolverine with MDHHS worker. Youth A reported having no
concerns with Staff 1. Youth A reported being aware of why he
was being interviewed. Youth A reported he does not interact with
Staff 1 much due to her position within the agency. Youth A
reported Staff 1 has not hit him. Youth A denied being jumped on
by Staff 1 or any other staff member at the facility. Youth A
2

reported feeling safe with all staff members at Wolverine Cetner.
Youth A refused to continue the interview and indicated he was
done with the interview. Youth A then left the room and exited the
building.
All of the following interviews were conducted at the facility
on 07/09/2025 in collaboration with MDHHS worker.
Vice President (VP) reported not having any concerns with Staff
1 work performance. VP denied being made aware of the
concerns regarding Staff 1 providing the youth with vape pens or
marijuana. VP reported not being aware of Staff 1 having a
romantic relationship with any of the staff members and reported
these concerns were investigated under #2025SIC0000554.
Program Director reported no concerns with Staff 1’s conduct
with Youth A or any other youth. Program Director reported being
recently employed at Wolverine Center for two months and is
unaware of the allegations regarding Staff 1 and Youth A. Per
Program Director, Youth A has a history of AWOL and leaves the
facility often and displays explosive behavior from time to time.
Program Director reported Youth A AWOL’d and returned to the
building early that morning. Program Director denied Staff 1
having any disciplinary action currently and reported Staff 1 is up
to date on her training. Program Director denied the other staff or
youth ever reporting issues with Staff 1.
Youth B reported feeling safe at Wolverine. Youth B reported he
has never seen Staff 1 hit Youth B or other youth in the facility.
Staff 1 denied all allegations. Staff 1 reported she has not
restrained a youth recently or physically harmed Youth A. While
she acknowledged being disciplined in the past for inappropriately
restraining a youth, she reported the incident occurred last year.
Staff 1 reported VP is aware of all allegations made against her
and reported them to be untrue. She was adamant that the other
allegations had already been investigated. Staff 1 further claimed
that staff members are making false allegations against her in
retaliation, as she is responsible for terminating employment.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face on 7/28/2025 at Wolverine
with MDHHS worker. Staff 2 reported working on the shift with
Staff 1 and is familiar with how she engages the youth. Staff 2
reported he has never witnessed Staff 1 hit youth.
3

Predisposition case conference held on 7/30/2025 via video
conference in collaboration with MDHHS worker. There were
no findings.
Documents Reviewed:
Staff 3 was interviewed via telephone on 7/28/25 by MDHHS
Worker. Per MDHHS worker notes. Staff 3 reported Youth A
makes up stories a lot of the time and sometimes it is hard to
believe him. Staff 3 reported there was one incident where she
gave a youth a pencil to use and Youth A became upset because
he was not given a pencil. Staff 3 reported Youth A told her he
would lie and tell the management that she had a relationship with
the youth she gave the pencil to so she could get fired. Staff 3
reported Youth A has displayed explosive behaviors before and
will AWOL often. Staff 3 reported she has heard Youth A say Staff
1 knows his mother from high school and reported Youth A has
said Staff 1 told him she will give his siblings candy and "fuck" his
mother. Staff 3 reiterated she has never witnessed firsthand Staff
1 doing anything Staff 3 reported numerous youth at Wolverine
Center will not say anything against Staff 1 due to them observing
no reprimands being made regarding Staff 1. Staff 3 reported
Program Director had only been working at Wolverine Center for
about two months and stated, "Technically Staff 1 runs the
building and because Program Director is still learning and has to
go to Staff 1 for everything." Staff 3 reported she feels something
needs to be done about Staff 1. Staff 3 reported the culture and
morale of Wolverine Center has gone down ever since Staff 1 has
been employed there.
Staff 1’s personnel file: Staff 1 was disciplined on 5/10/24 for
using inappropriate communication towards a youth. Staff 1
received a 3-day suspension and a written warning. On 3/07/2023,
Staff 1 was disciplined for incident timelessness. Staff 1 was
disciplined on 2/21/23 for Line-of-Sight violation. Staff 1 was
disciplined on 11/07/23 and a safety plan was implemented that
Staff 1 could not be around a youth without supervision.
Staff 1 completed CPI refresher training on 2/20/25, Appropriate
Behavior Management Techniques and EAP Services,
Appropriate Communication with Youth on 3/18/25
Prohibited Intervention Policy: Prohibits use of physical
discipline.
4

Analysis The agency was found to be in compliance. While Staff 1 has a
documented history of applying inappropriate restraints with youth
at the facility, there was insufficient evidence to support a rule
violation in this instance. Interviews with the Vice President,
Program Director, Staff 1, Staff 2, and Youth A did not confirm that
Staff 1 physically harm Youth A.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section Intervention standards and prohibitions
Description (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iv) Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or discriminatory
language including negative references to a youth's background or
appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats, ridicule, or
humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A staff member witnessed a youth endure verbal abuse by other
staff at the facility. The staff reported these concerns, but nothing
was done.
Investigation Interview:
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on 7/03/2025.
There was no additional information.
Youth A was interviewed face to face on 7/7/2025 at
Wolverine with MDHHS worker. As previously stated above,
Youth A reported having no concerns with Staff 1. Youth A
reported Staff 1 has not said anything derogatory to him. Youth A
refused to continue the interview and indicated he was done with
the interview.
All of the following interviews were conducted at the facility
on 07/09/2025 in collaboration with MDHHS worker.
As previously mentioned above.
Vice President (VP) reported not having any concerns with Staff
1 work performance. VP reported there have been no recent
reports of Staff 1 talking disrespectfully to Youth A or to any other
youth in the facility.
5

Program Director denied the other staff or youth ever reporting
issues with Staff 1. Program Director denied ever receiving reports
of Staff 1 saying anything inappropriate to Youth A about his
siblings or his mother.
Youth B reported feeling safe at Wolverine. Youth B reported he
has never seen Staff 1 talk inappropriately with other staff or to
Youth A.
Staff 1 denied using derogatory language toward Youth A or
making any comments about his family. Staff 1 also denied
threatening to beat Youth A, participating in or encouraging other
staff to “jump” him. Staff 1 reported VP is aware of all allegations
made against her and reported them to be untrue.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face on 7/28/2025 at Wolverine
with MDHHS worker. Staff 2 reported working on the shift with
Staff 1 and is familiar with how she engages the youth. Staff 2
reported he has never witnessed Staff 1 use derogatory language
towards Youth A.
Predisposition case conference held on 7/30/2025 via video
conference in collaboration with MDHHS worker. There were
no findings.
Documents Reviewed:
Staff 3 was interviewed via telephone on 7/28/25 by MDHHS
Worker. Per MDHHS worker notes. As previously mentioned
above, Staff 3 reported she has heard Youth A say Staff 1 knows
his mother from high school and reported Youth A has said Staff 1
told him she will give his siblings candy and "fuck" his mother.
Staff 3 reiterated she has never witnessed firsthand Staff 1 doing
anything or saying anything inappropriate towards Youth A. Staff 3
reported numerous youth at Wolverine Center will not say
anything against Staff 1 due to them observing no reprimands
being made regarding Staff 1. Staff 1 reported the culture and
morale of Wolverine Center has gone down ever since Staff 1 has
been employed there.
Employee Behavior Handbook: Prohibits the use of verbal
abuse, ridicule, humiliation or threat.
Analysis The agency was found to be in compliance. While Staff 1 has a
documented history of using derogatory language and her
demeanor was rude and uncooperative during the investigation,
6

there was insufficient evidence to support a rule violation in this
instance. Interviews with Vice President, Program Director, Staff
1, Staff 2, and Youth A did not confirm that Staff 1 made any
derogatory remarks toward Youth A.
Consultation:
Consultation was offered to the agency, and the Program Director
was made aware of concerns regarding Staff 1’s demeanor and
professionalism during the investigation. To prevent similar issues
in the future, it is recommended that the agency provide staff with
training on professional communication, reinforce expectations for
respectful conduct, implement a feedback system for reporting
concerns, and review internal standards to ensure alignment with
the agency’s values and responsibilities.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
